stem: The nurse is caring for an elderly client with confusion who is attempting to pull out an intravenous catheter. Based on the documentation in the De-escalation Attempt Log, match each intervention with its correct classification.

tabs.title: Nurses' Notes
tabs.content:
22:00: Client (84y/o female) with delirium status-post UTI. She is pick-pick-picking at her peripheral IV and has removed her oxygen cannula twice.
22:15: Nurse attempts various measures to keep the client safe without using mechanical restraints.

tabs.title: De-escalation Attempt Log
tabs.content:
TimeIntervention AttemptedLevel of RestrictionOutcome
22:20Moved client closer to the nurse's stationLowClient calmed by visibility
22:30Applied 'mitten' restraints to bilateral handsHighClient unable to grasp IV
22:45Provided family photos and soft musicLowClient distracted
23:00Concealed IV site with gauze and long sleeveLowClient stopped picking

tabs.title: Vital Signs
tabs.content: Stable. Temp 38.1Â°C (consistent with UTI). Pulse 88, RR 18.

rows.text: Placing the client in a room near the nurse's station
Providing the client with a diversionary activity (e.g., folding towels)
Concealing medical equipment with gauze or sleeves

rationale.correct: Mechanical restraints (c2) include anything that physically restricts movement, such as mittens (r2) and vests (r4). Less-restrictive alternatives (c1) focus on environmental changes, behavioral distraction, or concealment of the 'target' of agitation (r1, r3, r5).
clinicalPearls: Mittens are considered restraints if they are tied to the bed or if they prevent the patient from using their hands for ADLs.
Always document that less-restrictive measures were tried and failed before moving to restraints.
Concealment (covering the IV) is a highly effective non-restraint technique for confused elders.

questionTrap.trap: Thinking that a 'mitten' is just a glove and therefore not a restraint.
questionTrap.howToOvercome: If it limits the patient's purposeful movement, it is a restraint.

mnemonic.title: Less is More
mnemonic.expansion: Try the Environment, try the Equipment (conceal), then try the End-result (restraint).
